channel.title: Posts on Dominic Mulligan
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Dominic Mulligan

item.title: Privacy-preserving collaborative compute with Veracruz
item.description: Veracruz is a project that I’ve been working on for a while internally within Arm Research. Recently, Veracruz was released as an open-source project on Github, with all development and design discussions moving into the open. This was a precursor to the project being adopted by the Linux Foundation’s Confidential Computing Consortium (CCC), which I’m pleased to say finally happened a few weeks ago, at the beginning of April. In this post, I’ll explain a little bit more about the project and what its motivation.

item.title: Publications list
item.description: I have now moved my bibliography over from my old website. The list can be found here.

item.title: New Homepage
item.description: Due to increasing unreliability of my website host, and regular security issues with WordPress, I have moved to a static site hosted on Github pages.
